import itertools
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import statsmodels.stats.api as sms
from scipy.stats import ttest_1samp, shapiro, levene, ttest_ind, mannwhitneyu, pearsonr, spearmanr, kendalltau, \
    f_oneway, kruskal
from statsmodels.stats.proportion import proportions_ztest

pd.set_option("display.max_columns",None);
pd.set_option("display.max_rows",None);

source.37ef2f40:

print('Test Stat = %.4f, p-value = %.4f' % (test_stat, pvalue))
source.f6dace5a:
test_stat, pvalue = shapiro(test["Purchase"])
print('Test Stat = %.4f, p-value = %.4f' % (test_stat, pvalue))
source.4d39b9a5:

                           test["Purchase"])
print('Test Stat = %.4f, p-value = %.4f' % (test_stat, pvalue))
source.bd62a7db:
test_stat, pvalue = ttest_ind(control["Purchase"],
                              test["Purchase"],
                              equal_var=True)

print('Test Stat = %.4f, p-value = %.4f' % (test_stat, pvalue))

source.415b6ece:
## 💡 2. Hypothesis Testing (A/B Testing)

### Application of the Hypothesis

#### 1. Establish Hypotheses
#### 2. Assumption control

>   - 1. Normality Assumption
>   - 2. Variance Homogeneity

#### 3. Implementation of the Hypothesis

>   **p-value < 0.05 H0 reject**
  1. If available, independent two-sample t-test (parametric test) if both is satisfied
2 is provided, 1 is not provided, we will not use this, but we will enter it as an argument

  2. Mannwhitneyu test if the assumptions are not met (non-parametric test) - also 1 overhangs, 2 if not, we will do the number 2

> **Note**:
* Number 2 directly if normality is not achieved. If variance homogeneity is not provided, an argument is entered for number 1.
* Pre-normality review and correction can be helpful.

---

#### ✔️ 1- Set up a hypothesis:
 * H0: M1 = M2 There is apparently no choice between Maximum Bid and Average Bids.
 * H1: M1!= M2 There is difference 
 
#### 2- Assumption Control:
#### 1. Normality Assumption:
#### 2. Variance Homogeneity Assumption

source.54066343: ## 🚩 5. Action ( What is the advice to the customer? )
source.ced720cd:
* (When we look at the averages of the Control(Maxsimum bid) and Test(Average bid) groups, there is a mathematical difference. However, it is not known whether this difference occurred by chance. As a result of the parametric t-test, there was no significant difference between the returns of the old and new systems. With the new system It is seen that the click rate decreases when the click rate of the old system is encountered. As a result of the rate test for the click rate, the Maxsimum Bidding rate was found to be greater than the Average Bidding rate. It will be better to continue the analysis at regular intervals by increasing the number of observations. It will be better to continue with the current system.)

* (Control(Maksimum teklif) ve Test(Ortalama teklif) gruplarının satın alma ortalamalarına baktığımızda matematiksel olarak bir farklılık vardır . Fakat bu farklılığın şans eserimi ortaya çıkıp çıkmadığı bilinmemektedir. Parametrik bir test olan bağımsız iki örneklem t testine göre eski ve yeni sistemlerin getirileri arasında %95 güvenle bır fark çıkmamıştır. Biz getirisi ortalaması yüksek olan sistemide seçebiliriz. Yada iki grubun tıklanma oranı arasında anlamlı bir farklılığını test edebiliriz. İki grubun tıklanma oranlarına baktığımızda maxsimum bidding in average bidding e göre daha yüksek olduğu görülmektedir. Bu farklılığın şans eseri ortaya çıkıp çıkmadığını araştırmak için oran testi yapıldı. Oran testi uyguladığımızda %95 güven ile teklif verme türleri oranları arasında anlamlı bir farklılık çıkmıştır. İki grubun oranlarına baktığımızda sonuç maxsimum biddingin daha yüksek olduğunu göstermektedir.)

* Since the assumption of normality is provided in the Assumption Controls, we did not reject the result because p-value>0.05.

* We looked at the variance assumption, and we did not reject it because the result in variance homogeneity was again p-value>0.05. As a result, we applied the parametric t-test since it was provided in our two assumptions.

* Since p-value <0.05  in the parametric test result, H0 cannot be rejected. As well as the allegedly put forward opinion is accepted.

* In other words, there is no statistically significant difference between the two maxsing bidding and average bidding.
source.679144cd:
#### **Click-Through-Rate (Tıklanma Oranı)**
* CTR is the number of clicks that your ad receives divided by the number of times your ad is shown: clicks ÷ impressions = CTR. For example, if you had 5 clicks and 100 impressions, then your CTR would be 5%
source.b32e783d:

source.f8743cf8:
### 🔎 Independent two-sample t-test(Parametric Test)

> H0 : When it comes to Maximum Bidding and Average Bidding, there is no statistically significant difference between the purchasing amounts of the two groups. (μ1=μ2)

>   H1 : ... there is a difference (μ1≠μ2)

* The normality of the Mean Bid Set (Test) metric dataset was not rejected, so the Hypothesis-independent parametric t-test was applied.

* Hypothesis :

 **H0**: There is no significant difference in the amount of Maximum Bid and Average Bid received from these two people. (μ1≠μ2)

 **H1**: ... there is a difference (μ1≠μ2)
source.a6635f86:

 * H0 : Normal distribution assumption is provided.
 * H1 : Normality is not ensured.

source.286996e8:
* **Business Problem** :  A commany has recently introduced a new type of bidding, the average bidding, as an alternative to the bid given to the current maximum bidding.

* One of our clients, bombabomba.com, decided to test this new feature and would like to do an A/B test to see if average bidding converts more than maximum bidding.

* **Maximum Bidding (Control Group)**
* **Average Bidding (Test Group)**

* This dataset, which contains the website information of bombabomba.com, there is information such as the number of advertisements that users see and click, as well as earnings information from here. There are two separate data sets, the control and test groups.

**Variables** :
> - **Impression** – Ad views
> - **Click**      – (Indicates the number of clicks on the displayed ad.)
> - **Purchase**   - (Indicates the number of products purchased after the ads clicked.)
> - **Earning**    - (Earnings after purchased products)

source.6a178baa:
### 🔎 **Two Sample Ratio Test**

**H0** There is no significant difference between Maximum Bidding (clicks/views) rate and Average Bidding (clicks/views) rates.

**H1** There is difference.

> ##### **H0** : Maxsimum Bidding'in (tıklama/görüntüleme) oranı, Average Bidding(tıklama/görüntüleme) oranları arasında anlamlı bir farklılık yoktur.
> ##### **H1** : ...   vardır.


**Proportions_ztest**
* In order to perform this test, only n1 and n2 must be greater than 30.
